text: Raymond Thomas Adams (September 28, 1912 – August 26, 1992) was an American professional basketball player. He played for the Oshkosh All-Stars and Chicago Bruins in the National Basketball League and averaged 4.1 points per game. Adams also coached high school basketball, served in World War II, and became a tax and financial consultant. ==References== Category:1912 births Category:1992 deaths Category:American army personnel of World War II Category:American men's basketball players Category:Basketball players from Illinois Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Chicago Bruins players Category:DePaul Blue Demons men's basketball players Category:Forwards (basketball) Category:High school basketball coaches in the United States Category:Oshkosh All-Stars players Category:Sportspeople from Chicago
title: Ray Adams (basketball)
